page.title: 07FARMING IN BEMPTON & BUCKTON
page.content: The main use of land in the area is for {farming, approximately}90% of the block is used for{crops}and the raising of{livestock.}The main crops grown are barley, wheat and rape whilst the grassland is used by sheep and cattle. Most of the cattle are reared for the production of{beef;} there is only one{milk}producing herd which is located at Grange Farm.{ { }To the east of Grange Farm, on Cliff Lane, there is an {intensive {beef} rearing unit and there are plans to construct an intensive pig unit at Buckton.
